name: Anik Bosse
body: 11 JANUARY 2, 2018 2018-11 1. Under subsections 20.1(1) and 20.1(3) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers' Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Anik Bosse, Edmundston, New Brunswick, as a Vice-Chairperson of the Workers' Compensation Appeals Tribunal, effective April 1, 2018, for a term of three years. 2. name: Jennifer Richard
body: 3 JANUARY 2, 2018 2018-3 1. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsections 5(2) and 7(1) of the New Brunswick Women's Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the New Brunswick Association of CBDCs, a member organization, represented by Line Doiron, Bathurst, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Women's Council, effective January 2, 2018, for a term ending May 31, 2018. 2. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsection 5(2) of the New Brunswick Women's Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the New Brunswick Aboriginal People's Council, a member organization, represented by Wendy Wetteland, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Women's Council, effective January 2, 2018, for a term ending May 31, 2020. 3. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsection 5(2) of the New Brunswick Women's Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Martine Marchand, Edmundston, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Women's Council, effective January 2, 2018, for a term ending May 31, 2020. 4. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsection 5(2) of the New Brunswick Women's Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Louise Seales, Saint John, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Women's Council, effective January 2, 2018, for a term ending May 31, 2020. 5. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsection 5(2) of the New Brunswick Women's Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Patricia Morris, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Women's Council, effective January 2, 2018, for a term ending May 31, 2020. 3 -2 6. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsection 5(2) of the New Brunswick Women's Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the Fredericton Sexual Assault Centre, represented by Jennifer Richard, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Women's Council, effective January 2, 2018, for a term ending May 31, 2020. 7. Under section 26 of the Interpretation Act and subsection 7(1) of the New Brunswick Women's Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes paragraph (f) of Order in Council 2017-105, dated May 4, 2017. Jocelyne Roy Vienneau Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui precede est une copie conforme d'un decret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the 2 January 2018. de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le Clerk of the Executive Council/Greffier du Conseil executif

Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsections 5(2) and 7(1) of the New Brunswick Women's Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the New Brunswick Association of CBDCs, a member organization, represented by Line Doiron, Bathurst, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Women's Council, effective January 2, 2018, for a term ending May 31, 2018. 2. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsection 5(2) of the New Brunswick Women's Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the New Brunswick Aboriginal People's Council, a member organization, represented by Wendy Wetteland, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Women's Council, effective January 2, 2018, for a term ending May 31, 2020. 3. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsection 5(2) of the New Brunswick Women's Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Martine Marchand, Edmundston, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Women's Council, effective January 2, 2018, for a term ending May 31, 2020. 4. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsection 5(2) of the New Brunswick Women's Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Louise Seales, Saint John, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Women's Council, effective January 2, 2018, for a term ending May 31, 2020. 5. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsection 5(2) of the New Brunswick Women's Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Patricia Morris, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Women's Council, effective January 2, 2018, for a term ending May 31, 2020. 3 -2 6. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsection 5(2) of the New Brunswick Women's Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the Fredericton Sexual Assault Centre, represented by Jennifer Richard, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Women's Council, effective January 2, 2018, for a term ending May 31, 2020. 7. Under section 26 of the Interpretation Act and subsection 7(1) of the New Brunswick Women's Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes paragraph (f) of Order in Council 2017-105, dated May 4, 2017. Jocelyne Roy Vienneau Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui precede est une copie conforme d'un decret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the 2 January 2018. de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le Clerk of the Executive Council/Greffier du Conseil executif

Under paragraph 11(1)(a) and subsections 11(2) and 12(3) of the Service New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Garth Lawson, Rexton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Directors of Service New Brunswick, effective January 2, 2018, for a term of three years. 3. name: Roger Senechal
body: 5 JANUARY 2, 2018 2018-5 1. Under subsections 24(1) and 24(2) of New Brunswick Regulation 95-61, the General Regulation — Family Income Security Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Jami Moore, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Family Income Security Appeal Board, effective January 2, 2018, for a term ending March 31, 2020. 2. Under subsections 24(1) and 24(2) of New Brunswick Regulation 95-61, the General Regulation — Family Income Security Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints James Proudfoot, Moncton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Family Income Security Appeal Board, effective January 2, 2018, for a term ending March 31, 2020. 3. Under subsections 24(1) and 24(2) of New Brunswick Regulation 95-61, the General Regulation — Family Income Security Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Roger Senechal, Beresford, New Brunswick, as a member of the Family Income Security Appeal Board, effective January 2, 2018, for a term ending March 31, 2020. 4. name: Eddy Robichaud
body: 14 JANUARY 10, 2018 2018-14 iL: Under subsections 3(1) and 3(4) and paragraph 3(2)(a) of the New Brunswick Grain Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Kier Miller, Sussex Corner, New Brunswick, representing producers, as a member and chair of the New Brunswick Grain Commission, for a term of four years, effective January 10, 2018. 2. Under subsections 3(1) and 3(4) and paragraph 3(2)(a) of the New Brunswick Grain Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Eddy Robichaud, Shippagan, New Brunswick, representing producers, as vice-chair of the New Brunswick Grain Commission, for a term of four years, effective January 10, 2018. 3. Under subsections 3(1) and 3(4) and paragraph 3(2)(d) of the New Brunswick Grain Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Gerald Chevrier, Stanley, New Brunswick, who is employed within the Department of Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries, as a member of the New Brunswick Grain Commission, for a term of four years, effective January 10, 2018.. 4. Under subsections 3(1) and 3(4) and paragraph 3(2)(a) of the New Brunswick Grain Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Stephanie Cormier, Drummond, New Brunswick, representing producers, as a member of the New Brunswick Grain Commission, for a term of four years, effective January 10, 2018. 14 5, Under subsections 3(1) and 3(4) and paragraph 3(2)(a) of the New Brunswick Grain Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Murphy Friesen, Greenfield, New Brunswick, representing producers, as a member of the New Brunswick Grain Commission, for a term of four years, effective January 10, 2018. Under section 3 of New Brunswick Regulation 95-122, the General Regulation — Agricultural Insurance Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Beth Hatt, St. George, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Agricultural Commission, for a term of three years, effective January 10, 2018. 2: Under section 3 of New Brunswick Regulation 95-122, the General Regulation — Agricultural Insurance Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints David DuPlessis, Douglas, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Agricultural Commission, for a term of three years, effective January 10, 2018. 3. Under section 3 of New Brunswick Regulation 95-122, the General Regulation — Agricultural Insurance Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Léopold Bourgeois, Cocagne, New Brunswick, as Chairperson of the New Brunswick Agricultural Commission, for a term of three years, effective January 10, 2018. 4. Under section 3 of New Brunswick Regulation 95-122, the General Regulation — Agricultural Insurance Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Gailen Allan, Glassville, New Brunswick, as Vice-Chairperson of the New Brunswick Agricultural Commission, for a term of three years, effective January 10, 2018. 5: Under section 3 of New Brunswick Regulation 95-122, the General Regulation — Agricultural Insurance Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints John Robinson Jr., Sussex, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Agricultural Commission, for a term of three years, effective January 10, 2018. 15 6. Under section 3 of New Brunswick Regulation 95-122, the General Regulation — Agricultural Insurance Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Arséne Roussel, Tracadie-Sheila, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Agricultural Commission, for a term of three years, effective January 10, 2018. fs Under section 3 of New Brunswick Regulation 95-122, the General Regulation — Agricultural Insurance Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Gilles Godbout, Grand Falls, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Agricultural Commission, for a term of three years, effective January 10, 2018. name: Katherine McBrearty
body: 19 JANUARY 10, 2018 2018-19 1. Under subsection 26(1) of The Residential Tenancies Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Katherine McBrearty, Saint John, New Brunswick, as a residential tenancies officer, effective January 10, 2018. 2. name: Kier Miller
body: 14 JANUARY 10, 2018 2018-14 iL: Under subsections 3(1) and 3(4) and paragraph 3(2)(a) of the New Brunswick Grain Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Kier Miller, Sussex Corner, New Brunswick, representing producers, as a member and chair of the New Brunswick Grain Commission, for a term of four years, effective January 10, 2018. 2. Under subsections 3(1) and 3(4) and paragraph 3(2)(a) of the New Brunswick Grain Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Eddy Robichaud, Shippagan, New Brunswick, representing producers, as vice-chair of the New Brunswick Grain Commission, for a term of four years, effective January 10, 2018. 3. Under subsections 3(1) and 3(4) and paragraph 3(2)(d) of the New Brunswick Grain Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Gerald Chevrier, Stanley, New Brunswick, who is employed within the Department of Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries, as a member of the New Brunswick Grain Commission, for a term of four years, effective January 10, 2018.. 4. Under subsections 3(1) and 3(4) and paragraph 3(2)(a) of the New Brunswick Grain Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Stephanie Cormier, Drummond, New Brunswick, representing producers, as a member of the New Brunswick Grain Commission, for a term of four years, effective January 10, 2018. 14 5, Under subsections 3(1) and 3(4) and paragraph 3(2)(a) of the New Brunswick Grain Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Murphy Friesen, Greenfield, New Brunswick, representing producers, as a member of the New Brunswick Grain Commission, for a term of four years, effective January 10, 2018. Jocelyne Roy Vienneau Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the 10 January 2018 e i de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le . Clerk of the Executive Council/Greffier du Conseil exécutif

name: Paul Mazerolle
body: 11 JANUARY 25, 2019 2019-11 Under subsection 19(2) of the University of New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Paul Mazerolle, Queensland, Australia, as President of the University of New Brunswick, effective July 1, 2019, for a term ending June 30, 2024, (Mun Acfetgy A Kathleen Quigg Administrator This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d'un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 25 January, 2019. name: Benson Milner
body: 45 JANUARY 30, 2018 2018-45 4's Under subsections 3(1), 3(2) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Cathy LaRochelle, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, representing the Department of Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries, and designates her as Chair, for a term of three years, effective February 1, 2018. 2. Under subsections 3(1), 3(2) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Sadie Perron, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member, of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, representing the Department of Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries, and designates her as Vice- Chair, for a term of three years, effective February 1, 2018. 3. Under subsections 3(1) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Paul Fudge, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, representing Opportunities New Brunswick, for a term of three years, effective February 1, 2018. 4. Under subsections 3(1) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Jan Rademaker, Grand Falls, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, representing agriculture, for a term of three years, effective February 1, 2018. 45 5. Under subsections 3(1) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Brian McCullum, Pearsonville, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, representing agriculture, for a term of three years, effective February 1, 2018. 6. Under subsections 3(1) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Bev Bacon, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, representing fisheries and aquaculture, for a term of three years, effective February 1, 2018. G Under subsections 3(1) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Benson Milner, Pointe-du- Chéne, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, representing fisheries and aquaculture, for a term of three years, effective February 1, 2018. 8. Under subsections 3(1) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Doris Losier, Bouctouche, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, representing fisheries and aquaculture, for a term of three years, effective February 1, 2018. Jocelyne Roy Vienneau Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 30 January 2018. Clerk of the Executive Council/Greffier du Conseil exécutif CPt Sep

name: Cathy LaRochelle
position: Member of the Board of Directors
body: 53 JANUARY 30, 2018 2018-53 Ass Under subsection 4(2) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Eric Beaulieu, as President of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, effective January 30, 2018. 2. Under subsection 4(2) of the New Brunswick Housing Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes section 4 of Order in Council 2017-87 dated April 12, 2017. 3. Under section 2 of the Regional Development Corporation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Cathy LaRochelle as a member of the Board of Directors of the Regional Development Corporation, effective January 30, 2018. 4. Under section 2 of the Regional Development Corporation Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes paragraph 1(c) of Order in Council 2015-239 dated October 7, 2015. 5. Under paragraph 7(1)(a) and subsection 10(1) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Cathy LaRochelle, as a member of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, effective January 30, 2018, for a term to expire August 16, 2019. 53 6. Under section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council revokes section 2 of Order in Council 2016-206 dated August 17, 2016. Jocelyne Roy Vienneau Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d'un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 30 January 2018. name: Cathy LaRochelle
body: 45 JANUARY 30, 2018 2018-45 4's Under subsections 3(1), 3(2) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Cathy LaRochelle, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, representing the Department of Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries, and designates her as Chair, for a term of three years, effective February 1, 2018. 2. Under subsections 3(1), 3(2) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Sadie Perron, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member, of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, representing the Department of Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries, and designates her as Vice- Chair, for a term of three years, effective February 1, 2018. 3. Under subsections 3(1) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Paul Fudge, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, representing Opportunities New Brunswick, for a term of three years, effective February 1, 2018. 4. Under subsections 3(1) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Brian McCullum, Pearsonville, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, representing agriculture, for a term of three years, effective February 1, 2018. 6. name: Cathy LaRochelle
body: 53 JANUARY 30, 2018 2018-53 Ass Under subsection 4(2) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Eric Beaulieu, as President of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, effective January 30, 2018. 2. Under subsection 4(2) of the New Brunswick Housing Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes section 4 of Order in Council 2017-87 dated April 12, 2017. 3. Under section 2 of the Regional Development Corporation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Cathy LaRochelle as a member of the Board of Directors of the Regional Development Corporation, effective January 30, 2018. 4. Under section 2 of the Regional Development Corporation Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes paragraph 1(c) of Order in Council 2015-239 dated October 7, 2015. 5. Under paragraph 7(1)(a) and subsection 10(1) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Cathy LaRochelle, as a member of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, effective January 30, 2018, for a term to expire August 16, 2019. 53 6. Under section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council revokes section 2 of Order in Council 2016-206 dated August 17, 2016. name: Kevin McKendy
body: 46 JANUARY 30, 2018 2018-46 fl: Under paragraph 2(2)(a) and subsections 2(3), 2(4) and 3(1) of the Agriculture Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Paul Jordan, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member and vice-chair of the Agriculture Appeal Board, nominated by the Minister of Environment and Local Government, for a term of five years, effective January 31, 2018. 2. Under paragraph 2(2)(b) and subsections 2(3) and 3(1) of the Agriculture Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Paul-Emile Soucy, Saint-Basile, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture Appeal Board, representing livestock producers, for a term of five years, effective January 31, 2018. 3. Under paragraph 2(2)(b) and subsections 2(3) and 3(1) of the Agriculture Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Yves Banville, St-Quentin, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture Appeal Board, representing livestock producers, for a term of five years, effective January 31, 2018. 4. Under paragraph 2(2)(c) and subsections 2(3), 2(4) and 3(1) of the Agriculture Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Maurice Maillet, Ste-Marie-de-Kent, New Brunswick, as a member and chair of the Agriculture Appeal Board, representing agricultural producers, for a term of five years, effective January 31, 2018. 46 5. Under paragraph 2(2)(d) and subsections 2(3) and 3(1) of the Agriculture Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Kevin McKendy, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Agriculture Appeal Board, who is not an employee of the Civil Service, for a term of five years, effective January 31, 2018. Jocelyne Roy Vienneau Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 30 January 2018. pio Clerk of the Executive Council/Greffier du Conseil exécutif

name: Cheryl Geldart Greer
body: 64 FEBRUARY 14, 2018 2018-64 Under section 4 of the Atlantic Provinces Harness Racing Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Finance, nominates Cheryl Geldart Greer, Norton, New Brunswick, for appointment by the Council of the Atlantic Premiers, as a commissioner of the Atlantic Provinces Harness Racing Commission, for a term of two years, effective April 1, 2018. name: Douglas Jones

Malenfant, for electoral district 39, New Maryland- Sunbury; and (d) Judi Sloat, for electoral district 41, Fredericton North. 2: Under subsection 9(1) of the Elections Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes: (a) paragraph (z) of Order in Council 2017-303 dated November 22, 2017; (b) paragraph (ff) of Order in Council 2017-303 dated November 22, 2017; (c) paragraph (mm) of Order in Council 2017-303 dated November 22, 2017; 83 (d) paragraph (00) of Order in Council 2017-303 dated November 22, 2017; 3. name: Anne Richard
body: 84 MARCH 14, 2018 2018-84 1. Under section 2.1 of the Intimate Partner Violence Intervention Act and subsection 5(2) of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council designates, as a category of persons, Emergency Adjudicative Officers appointed under the Judicature Act, as a designated authority for the purposes of the Intimate Partner Violence Intervention Act, to hear, and make determinations on, applications for emergency intervention orders. 2. Under subsections 18(1) and 18(3) of the Small Claims Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Tammy Moore, Saint John, New Brunswick, as an Adjudicator, for a term of ten years, effective April 30, 2018. 3. Under subsections 56.5(1) and 56.5(5) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice and Public Safety, appoints Tammy Moore, Saint John, New Brunswick, as an Emergency Adjudicative Officer, for a term of ten years, effective April 30, 2018. 4. Under subsections 56.1(1) and 56.1(5) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice and Public Safety, appoints Tammy Moore, Saint John, New Brunswick, as a Case Management Master, for a term of three years, effective April 30, 2018. 5. Under subsections 18(1) and 18(3) of the Small Claims Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Brian Maude, Saint John, New Brunswick, as an Adjudicator, for a term of ten years, effective April 9, 2018. 84 6. Under subsections 56.5(1) and 56.5(5) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice and Public Safety, appoints Brian Maude, Saint John, New Brunswick, as an Emergency Adjudicative Officer, for a term of ten years, effective April 9, 2018. 7. Under subsections 56.1(1) and 56.1(5) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice and Public Safety, appoints Brian Maude, Saint John, New Brunswick, as a Case Management Master, for a term of three years, effective April 9, 2018. 8. Under subsections 18(1) and 18(3) of the Small Claims Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Diane Deschénes, Moncton, New Brunswick, as an Adjudicator, for a term of ten years, effective April 9, 2018. 9. Under subsections 56.5(1) and 56.5(5) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice and Public Safety, appoints Diane Deschénes, Moncton, New Brunswick, as an Emergency Adjudicative Officer, for a term of ten years, effective April 9, 2018. 10. Under subsections 56.1(1) and 56.1(5) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice and Public Safety, appoints Diane Deschénes, Moncton, New Brunswick, as a Case Management Master, for a term of three years, effective April 9, 2018. 11. Under subsections 18(1) and 18(3) of the Small Claims Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Donald Boudreau, Bathurst, New Brunswick, as an Adjudicator, for a term of ten years, effective April 9, 2018. 84 12. Under subsections 56.5(1) and 56.5(5) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice and Public Safety, appoints Donald Boudreau, Bathurst, New Brunswick, as an Emergency Adjudicative Officer, for a term of ten years, effective April 9, 2018. 13. Under subsections 56.9(1) and 56.9(2) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council designates Donald Boudreau, Bathurst, New Brunswick, as Chief Hearing Officer, for a term of ten years, effective April 9, 2018. 14. Under subsections 56.5(1) and 56.5(5) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice and Public Safety, appoints Anne Richard, Moncton, New Brunswick, as an Emergency Adjudicative Officer, for a term of ten years, effective April 9, 2018. 15. Under subsections 56.1(1) and 56.1(5) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice and Public Safety, appoints Anne Richard, Moncton, New Brunswick, as a Case Management Master, for a term of three years, effective April 9, 2018. 16. Under subsections 56.5(1) and 56.5(5) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice and Public Safety, appoints Matthew Cripps, Miramichi, New Brunswick, as an Emergency Adjudicative Officer, for a term of ten years, effective April 9, 2018. 17. Under section 61 and subsections 68(1) and 68(2) of the Judicature Act, subsection 12(1) of the Probate Court Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes: (a) Order in Council 2014-46 dated February 20, 2014; (b) Order in Council 96-316 dated March 21, 1996; and 84 (c) Order in Council 2000-184 dated April 20, 2000. 18. Under subsections 56.1(1) and 56.1(5) of the Judicature Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2015-255 dated October 28, 2015. name: Amélie Deschénes
body: 95 MARCH 21, 2018 2018-95 1. Under paragraph 4(1)(c) and subsections 4(2) and 4(3) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Amélie Deschénes, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a Director of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective April 1, 2018. 2: Under paragraph 4(1)(c) and subsections 4(2) and 4(3) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Scott Green, Woodstock, New Brunswick, as a Director of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective April 1, 2018. 3: Under paragraph 4(1)(c) and subsections 4(2) and 4(3) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Yvonne Samson, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a Director of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective April 1, 2018. 4. Under paragraph 4(1)(c) and subsections 4(2) and 4(3) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Tom MacFarlane, Nashwaak Bridge, New Brunswick, as a Director of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective April 1, 2018. 5. Under paragraph 4(1)(c) and subsections 4(2) and 4(3) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Carol Desrosiers, Beresford, New Brunswick, as a Director of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective April 1, 2018. 95 6. Under paragraph 4(1)(c) and subsections 4(2) and 4(3) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Lynn Ouellette Sauvageau, Grand Falls, New Brunswick, as a Director of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective April 1, 2018. 7. Under paragraph 4(1)(c) and subsections 4(2) and 4(3) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Carla Gregan-Burns, Miramichi, New Brunswick, as a Director of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective April 1, 2018. 8. Under paragraph 4(1)(c) and subsections 4(2) and 4(3) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Dominic Aubé, North Tetagouche, New Brunswick, as a Director of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective April 1, 2018. 9. Under paragraph 4(1)(b) and subsection 4(2) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Eric Beaulieu, Deputy Minister of Social Development, as President of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, effective March 21, 2018. Under paragraph 4(1)(c) and subsections 4(2) and 4(3) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Amélie Deschénes, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a Director of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective April 1, 2018. 2: Under paragraph 4(1)(c) and subsections 4(2) and 4(3) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Scott Green, Woodstock, New Brunswick, as a Director of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective April 1, 2018. 3: Under paragraph 4(1)(c) and subsections 4(2) and 4(3) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Yvonne Samson, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a Director of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective April 1, 2018. 4. Under paragraph 4(1)(c) and subsections 4(2) and 4(3) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Tom MacFarlane, Nashwaak Bridge, New Brunswick, as a Director of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective April 1, 2018. 5. Under paragraph 4(1)(c) and subsections 4(2) and 4(3) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Carol Desrosiers, Beresford, New Brunswick, as a Director of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective April 1, 2018. 95 6. Under paragraph 4(1)(c) and subsections 4(2) and 4(3) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Lynn Ouellette Sauvageau, Grand Falls, New Brunswick, as a Director of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective April 1, 2018. 7. Under paragraph 4(1)(c) and subsections 4(2) and 4(3) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Carla Gregan-Burns, Miramichi, New Brunswick, as a Director of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective April 1, 2018. 8. Under paragraph 4(1)(c) and subsections 4(2) and 4(3) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Dominic Aubé, North Tetagouche, New Brunswick, as a Director of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective April 1, 2018. 9. Under paragraph 4(1)(b) and subsection 4(2) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Eric Beaulieu, Deputy Minister of Social Development, as President of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, effective March 21, 2018. name: Anne Bertrand
position: Director of the board of directors
body: 155 APRIL 30, 2018 2018-155 4. Under paragraph 15(2)(b) and subsections 15(3) and 15(5) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints, from among those persons nominated by the board of directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation, the following persons as directors of the board of directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation, effective April 30, 2018, for a term to expire April 1, 2019: (a) Anne Bertrand, Fredericton, New Brunswick; (b) Nancy Whipp, Shediac Bridge, New Brunswick; and (c) Jennifer Henry, North Tetagouche, New Brunswick. 2. Under subsection 15(8) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council reappoints the following persons to the board of directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation, effective April 30, 2018, for a term to expire April 1, 2019: (a) Barbara Trenholm, Fredericton, New Brunswick; (b) Mike Wilson, Sackville, New Brunswick; (c) Charles Firlotte, Stratfort, Connecticut, USA; 155 (d) Mark Reddemann, Richland, Washington, USA; and (e) Judith Athaide, Calgary, Alberta. name: Donald Boudreau
body: 136 APRIL 30, 2018 2018-136 1. Under subsections 56.1(1) and 56.1(5) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice and Public Safety, appoints Donald Boudreau, Bathurst, New Brunswick, as a Case Management Master, for a term of three years, effective April 30, 2018. 2: Under subsections 56.1(1) and 56.1(5) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice and Public Safety, appoints Matthew Cripps, Miramichi, New Brunswick, as a Case Management Master, for a term of three years, effective April 30, 2018. name: Allison McCain
body: 202 JUNE 6, 2018 2018-202 1: Under subsection 18(1) and paragraph 23(1)(a) of the University of New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Allison McCain, Florenceville-Bristol, New Brunswick, as Chancellor of the University of New Brunswick, effective August 28, 2018, for a term ending July 1, 2023. 2. Under paragraph 23(1)(i) and subsection 24(1) of the University of New Brunswick, Act the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Gillian Paul, Killarney Road, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Governors of the University of New Brunswick, effective September 2, 2018, for a term ending July 1, 2021. 3: Under paragraph 23(1)(i) and subsection 24(1) of the University of New Brunswick, Act the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Janet Hoyt, Toronto, Ontario, as a member of the Board of Governors of the University of New Brunswick, effective September 2, 2018, for a term ending July 1, 2021. 4. Under paragraph 23(1)(i) and subsection 24(1) of the University of New Brunswick, Act the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Robyn Tingley, Rothesay, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Governors of the University of New Brunswick, effective November 21, 2018, for a term ending July 1, 2021. 202 5. Under paragraph 23(1)(i) and subsection 24(1) of the University of New Brunswick, Act the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Thomas Gribbons, Rothesay, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Governors of the University of New Brunswick, effective November 21, 2018, for a term ending July 1, 2021. Jocelyne Roy Vienneau Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 6 June 2018. Under subsections 7(1) and 7(2) of the New Brunswick Public Libraries Foundation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Marianne Mallia, Upper Kingsclear, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Public Libraries Foundation Board, representing the public at large, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2018. 3. name: Cody Boudreau
body: 192 JUNE 6, 2018 2018-192 1. Under subsection 2(3) of the Sheriffs Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Michel Boudreau, Shediac, New Brunswick, as Chief Sheriff for the Province of New Brunswick, effective June 6, 2018. 2. Under subsection 2(3) of the Sheriffs Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Cody Boudreau, Edmundston, New Brunswick, as a Deputy Sheriff for the Province of New Brunswick, effective June 6, 2018. 3. Under subsection 2(3) of the Sheriffs Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Valentina Cojocaru, Saint Jacques, New Brunswick, as a Deputy Sheriff for the Province of New Brunswick, effective June 6, 2018. 4. body: 273 JULY 12, 2018 2018-273 1. Under paragraphs 3(1)(a) and 3(2)(b) of the Forest Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints, on the recommendation of the Minister, Andrew Green, Rothesay, New Brunswick, as Chair of the New Brunswick Forest Products Commission, effective July 12, 2018, for a term of five years. 2: Under paragraphs 3(1)(d) and 3(2)(b) of the Forest Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints James Maurice Harquail, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Forest Products Commission, representing the Department of Energy and Resource Development, effective July 12, 2018, for a term of four years. 3. Under paragraphs 3(1)(b) and 3(2)(a) of the Forest Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Lisa Barkley, Baie Verte, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Forest Products Commission, representing producers, effective July 12, 2018, for a term of three years. 4. Under paragraphs 3(1)(b) and 3(2)(a) of the Forest Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Claude Pelletier, Edmundston, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Forest Products Commission, representing producers, effective July 12, 2018, for a term of two years. 273 5. Under paragraphs 3(1)(b) and 3(2)(a) of the Forest Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Gerard Robichaud, Neguac, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Forest Products Commission, representing forest industries, effective July 12, 2018, for a term of two years. Jocelyne Roy Vienneau Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 12 July 2018. Deputy Clerk of the wer Council/Greffier suppléant du Conseil exécutif

name: Kevin McKendy
body: 272 JULY 12, 2018 2018-272 fe Under subsections 5(1), 5(2) and paragraph 5(4)(e) of the Natural Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Victor Somerville, Juniper, New Brunswick, as a member engaged directly as a producer, of the New Brunswick Farm Products Commission, effective July 12, 2018, for a term of five years. 2. Under subsections 5(1), 5(2) and paragraph 5(4)(c) of the Natural Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Robert Speer, Holmesville, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Farm Products Commission, representing the Dairy Farmers of New Brunswick, effective July 12, 2018, for a term of five years. 3. Under subsections 5(1), 5(2) and paragraph 5(4)(d) of the Natural Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Paul Chiasson, Miramichi, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Farm Products Commission, representing the New Brunswick Milk Dealers Association, effective July 12, 2018, for a term of five years. 4. Under subsections 5(1), 5(2), 5(3) and paragraph 5(4)(f) of the Natural Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Kevin McKendy, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Farm Products Commission, nominated by the Minister, effective June 4, 2019, for a term of five years. 272 5. Under subsections 5(1), 5(2), 5(3) and paragraph 5(4)(f) of the Natural Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Kevin McKendy, Fredericton, New Brunswick, a member of the New Brunswick Farm Products Commission, nominated by the Minister, as Vice- Chairperson, effective July 12, 2018, for a term to expire June, 3, 2024. 6. Under subsections 5(1), 5(2) and 5(3) of the Natural Products Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Robert Shannon, Douglas, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Farm Products Commission, representing the Department of Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries, and is appointed Chairperson, effective July 12, 2018, for a term of five years. Jocelyne Roy Vienneau Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d'un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 12 July 2018. name: Darlene Doiron
body: 304 AUGUST 2, 2018 2018-304 15 Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsection 5(2) of the New Brunswick Women’s Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Darlene Doiron, Grand Barachois, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Women’s Council, effective August 2, 2018, for a term ending May 31, 2021. Di Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsection 5(2) of the New Brunswick Women’s Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the New Brunswick Association of CBDCs, a member organization, represented by Mayme Lefurgey, Campbellton, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Women’s Council, effective August 2, 2018, for a term ending May 31, 2021. 3. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsection 5(2) of the New Brunswick Women’s Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the New Brunswick Coalition for Pay Equity, a member organization, represented by Jody Dallaire, Moncton, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Women’s Council, effective August 2, 2018, for a term ending May 31, 2021. 4. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsection 5(2) of the New Brunswick Women’s Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Regroupement féministe du Nouveau-Brunswick, a member organization, represented by Nelly Dennene, Moncton, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Women’s Council, effective August 2, 2018, for a term ending May 31, 2021. 304 5. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsection 5(2) of the New Brunswick Women’s Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Noélla Richard, Cocage, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick Women’s Council, effective August 2, 2018, for a term ending May 31, 2021. name: George MacDonald
position: member of the Board of Directors
body: 301 AUGUST 2, 2018 2018-301 1. Under subsections 3(1) and 3(2) of the Kings Landing Corporation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister, appoints Mary Ellen Vaughan, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Directors of the Kings Landing Corporation, effective August 2, 2018, for a term of three years. 2. Under subsections 3(1) and 3(2) of the Kings Landing Corporation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister, appoints George MacDonald, Prince William, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Directors of the Kings Landing Corporation, effective August 2, 2018, for a term of three years. 3. Under paragraph 21(1)(a) of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes section 2 of Order in Council 2017- 216 dated August 31, 2017. name: Andrew Harvey
position: Minister of Environment and Local Government
body: 332 OCTOBER 5, 2018 2018-332 is Under subsection 3(1) of the Executive Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the Honourable Denis Landry, Acting Minister of Transportation and Infrastructure, effective October 5, 2018, in addition to continuing to perform all duties incident to the Minister of Justice and Public Safety, who shall also be Solicitor General. 2: Under subsection 3(1) of the Executive Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the Honourable Gilles LePage, Acting Minister of Tourism, Heritage and Culture, effective October 5, 2018, in addition to continuing to perform all duties incident to the Minister of Labour, Employment and Population Growth. 3: Under subsection 3(1) of the Executive Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the Honourable Benoit Bourque, Acting Minister of Aquaculture and Fisheries, effective October 5, 2018, in addition to continuing to perform all duties incident to the Minister of Health and the Minister of Service New Brunswick. 4. Under subsection 3(1) of the Executive Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the Honourable Roger Melanson, Acting Minister of Energy and Resource Development, effective October 5, 2018, in addition to continuing to perform all duties incident to the President of Treasury Board and the Minister of Post-Secondary Education. 332 5. Under subsection 3(1) of the Executive Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the Honourable Andrew Harvey, Acting Minister of Agriculture, Mines and Rural Affairs, effective October 5, 2018, in addition to continuing to perform all duties incident to the Minister of Environment and Local Government. Jocelyne Roy Vienneau Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d'un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 5 October 2018. iClehrk of the Executive Council/Greffier du Conseil exécutif

Jocelyne Roy Vienneau Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d'un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 5 October 2018. iClehrk of the Executive Council/Greffier du Conseil exécutif

body: 346 NOVEM9B , E20R18 2018-346 Under section 1 of the Executive Council Act, the Lieutenant- Governor appoints the following persons as members of the Executive Council, effective November 9, 2018: (a) Blaine Higgs, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Quispamsis; (b) Robert Gauvin, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Shippagan-Laméque-Miscou; (c) Andrea Anderson-Mason, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Fundy-The Isles-Saint John West; (d) Ross Wetmore, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Gagetown-Petitcodiac; (e) Mary E. Wilson, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Oromocto-Lincoln-Fredericton; (f) Dominic Cardy, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Fredericton West-Hanwell; (g) Mike Holland, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Albert; 346 (h) Jeff Carr, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of New Maryland-Sunbury; (i) Dorothy Shephard, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Saint John Lacaster; (j) Ernie Steeves, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Moncton Northwest; (k) Hugh John (Ted) Flemming, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Rothesay; (1) Carl Urquhart, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Carleton-York; (m) Trevor Holder, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Portland-Simonds; (n) Sherry Wilson, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Moncton Southwest; (o) Bill Oliver, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Kings Centre; (p) Honourable Greg Thompson, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district Saint Croix; and 346 (q) Jake Stewart, a member of the Legislative Assembly for the electoral district of Southwest Miramichi-Bay du Vin. name: Brian Eyolfson
body: 365 NOVEMBER 28, 2018 2018-365 WHEREAS by Order-in-Council 2016-253 dated October 5, 2016, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council directed a Commission be issued, for the period beginning October 5, 2016, under the Inquiries Act, appointing five persons as commissioners to conduct a National Inquiry into Missing and Murdered Indigenous Women and Girls and whereas the Commission was required to deliver a final report before November 1, 2018; WHEREAS on June 6, 2018, the federal government, by Order- in-Council P.C. 2018-0686, amended Order in Council P.C. 2016-736 dated August 2, 2016, to extend the period of the Inquiry until June 30, 2019 and to remove Marilyn Poitras as a Commissioner; WHEREAS it is desirable to extend the period for the Commissioners to submit a final report until April 30, 2019; AND WHEREAS Commissioner Marilyn Poitras resigned on July 5, 2017; NOW THEREFORE, under Section 2 of the Inquiries Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council directs that the Commission of Inquiry established under Order-in-Council 2016-253: (a) continue with the Honourable Marion R. Butler, Michéle Tania Audette, E. Qajaq Robinson and Brian Eyolfson, as Commissioners; and 365 (b) deliver to the Attorney General of the Province of New Brunswick and the Government of Canada a final report, to be submitted before April 30, 2019, setting out the Commissioner's findings and recommendations. Jocelyne Roy Vienneau Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d'un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 28 November 2018. name: E. Qajaq Robinson
body: 365 NOVEMBER 28, 2018 2018-365 WHEREAS by Order-in-Council 2016-253 dated October 5, 2016, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council directed a Commission be issued, for the period beginning October 5, 2016, under the Inquiries Act, appointing five persons as commissioners to conduct a National Inquiry into Missing and Murdered Indigenous Women and Girls and whereas the Commission was required to deliver a final report before November 1, 2018; WHEREAS on June 6, 2018, the federal government, by Order- in-Council P.C. 2018-0686, amended Order in Council P.C. 2016-736 dated August 2, 2016, to extend the period of the Inquiry until June 30, 2019 and to remove Marilyn Poitras as a Commissioner; WHEREAS it is desirable to extend the period for the Commissioners to submit a final report until April 30, 2019; AND WHEREAS Commissioner Marilyn Poitras resigned on July 5, 2017; NOW THEREFORE, under Section 2 of the Inquiries Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council directs that the Commission of Inquiry established under Order-in-Council 2016-253: (a) continue with the Honourable Marion R. Butler, Michéle Tania Audette, E. Qajaq Robinson and Brian Eyolfson, as Commissioners; and 365 (b) deliver to the Attorney General of the Province of New Brunswick and the Government of Canada a final report, to be submitted before April 30, 2019, setting out the Commissioner's findings and recommendations. Jocelyne Roy Vienneau Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d'un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 28 November 2018. Deputy Clerk of the Executive Council/Greffier suppléant du Conseil exécutif ative. (roVuI nKor-ps

name: Andrea Hull
body: 369 DECEMBER 5, 2018 2018-369 1. Under section 61 of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Chantal Moreau, Edmundston, New Brunswick, as Deputy Registrar of the Court of Queen’s Bench of New Brunswick, effective December 5, 2018. 2. Under section 61 of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Andrea Hull, Southampton, New Brunswick, as Deputy Registrar of the Court of Queen’s Bench of New Brunswick, effective December 5, 2018. 3. Under subsection 68(1) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Andrea Hull, Southampton, New Brunswick, as Clerk of the Court of Queen’s Bench -T rial Division, for the judicial district of Fredericton, effective December 5, 2018. 5. name: Charles Murray
body: 383 DECEMBER 20, 2018 2018-383 Al Under paragraph 10(1)(a) of the Integrity Commissioner Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Charles Murray as Acting Integrity Commissioner, effective January 1, 2019. 2. Under subsection 10(4) of the Integrity Commissioner Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council fixes the salary of Charles Murray, Acting Integrity Commissioner, at Step D, Level II of the Deputy Head Pay Plan; together with reimbursement of expenses in accordance with the New Brunswick Government Travel Directive AD-2801, as it applies to Deputy Heads, effective December 31, 2018.
